property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Armed men standing on a hill

note.text: Insurgents seek land and authority for political and religious reasons. Some groups form alliances toward common goals, while others oppose the efforts of rival groups. Insurgent operations destabilize local government authority and threaten the safety of citizens.

In general, insurgents resist government oversight and interaction with the outside world. They have been known to cut off communication between villages by shutting down cellular towers. Insurgents have also provided humanitarian relief during natural disasters in order to gain the support of villagers.
